verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%> upon Muthlabben <S%H4192><s%> <S%H1121><s%>, A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%>. I will praise <S%H3034><s%> thee, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, with my whole heart <S%H3820><s%>; I will shew forth <S%H5608><s%> all thy marvellous works <S%H6381><s%>.
I will be glad <S%H8055><s%> and rejoice <S%H5970><s%> in thee: I will sing praise <S%H2167><s%> to thy name <S%H8034><s%>, O thou most High <S%H5945><s%>.
When mine enemies <S%H341><s%> are turned <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H268><s%>, they shall fall <S%H3782><s%> and perish <S%H6><s%> at thy presence <S%H6440><s%>.

For thou hast maintained <S%H6213><s%> my right <S%H4941><s%> and my cause <S%H1779><s%>; thou satest <S%H3427><s%> in the throne <S%H3678><s%> judging <S%H8199><s%> right <S%H6664><s%>. maintained: Heb. made my judgment judging right: Heb. judging in righteousness

Thou hast rebuked <S%H1605><s%> the heathen <S%H1471><s%>, thou hast destroyed <S%H6><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%>, thou hast put out <S%H4229><s%> their name <S%H8034><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%> and ever <S%H5703><s%>.

O thou enemy <S%H341><s%>, destructions <S%H2723><s%> are come to a perpetual <S%H5331><s%> end <S%H8552><s%>: and thou hast destroyed <S%H5428><s%> cities <S%H6145><s%> <S%H5892><s%>; their memorial <S%H2143><s%> is perished <S%H6><s%> with them <S%H1992><s%>. O thou: or, The destructions of the enemy are come to a perpetual end: and their cities hast thou destroyed, etc
But the LORD <S%H3068><s%> shall endure <S%H3427><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>: he hath prepared <S%H3559><s%> his throne <S%H3678><s%> for judgment <S%H4941><s%>.
And he shall judge <S%H8199><s%> the world <S%H8398><s%> in righteousness <S%H6664><s%>, he shall minister judgment <S%H1777><s%> to the people <S%H3816><s%> in uprightness <S%H4339><s%>.
The LORD <S%H3068><s%> also will be a refuge <S%H4869><s%> for the oppressed <S%H1790><s%>, a refuge <S%H4869><s%> in times <S%H6256><s%> of trouble <S%H6869><s%>. a refuge: Heb. an high place
And they that know <S%H3045><s%> thy name <S%H8034><s%> will put their trust <S%H982><s%> in thee: for thou, LORD <S%H3068><s%>, hast not forsaken <S%H5800><s%> them that seek <S%H1875><s%> thee.
Sing praises <S%H2167><s%> to the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, which dwelleth <S%H3427><s%> in Zion <S%H6726><s%>: declare <S%H5046><s%> among the people <S%H5971><s%> his doings <S%H5949><s%>.

When he maketh inquisition <S%H1875><s%> for blood <S%H1818><s%>, he remembereth <S%H2142><s%> them: he forgetteth <S%H7911><s%> not the cry <S%H6818><s%> of the humble <S%H6035><s%> <S%H6041><s%>. humble: or, afflicted

Have mercy <S%H2603><s%> upon me, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>; consider <S%H7200><s%> my trouble <S%H6040><s%> which I suffer of them that hate <S%H8130><s%> me, thou that liftest me up <S%H7311><s%> from the gates <S%H8179><s%> of death <S%H4194><s%>:

That I may shew forth <S%H5608><s%> all thy praise <S%H8416><s%> in the gates <S%H8179><s%> of the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Zion <S%H6726><s%>: I will rejoice <S%H1523><s%> in thy salvation <S%H3444><s%>.

The heathen <S%H1471><s%> are sunk down <S%H2883><s%> in the pit <S%H7845><s%> that they made <S%H6213><s%>: in the net <S%H7568><s%> which <S%H2098><s%> they hid <S%H2934><s%> is their own foot <S%H7272><s%> taken <S%H3920><s%>.

The LORD <S%H3068><s%> is known <S%H3045><s%> by the judgment <S%H4941><s%> which he executeth <S%H6213><s%>: the wicked <S%H7563><s%> is snared <S%H5367><s%> in the work <S%H6467><s%> of his own hands <S%H3709><s%>. Higgaion <S%H1902><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>. Higgaion: that is, Meditation
The wicked <S%H7563><s%> shall be turned <S%H7725><s%> into hell <S%H7585><s%>, and all the nations <S%H1471><s%> that forget <S%H7913><s%> God <S%H430><s%>.

For the needy <S%H34><s%> shall not alway <S%H5331><s%> be forgotten <S%H7911><s%>: the expectation <S%H8615><s%> of the poor <S%H6041><s%> <S%H6035><s%> shall not perish <S%H6><s%> for ever <S%H5703><s%>.
Arise <S%H6965><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>; let not man <S%H582><s%> prevail <S%H5810><s%>: let the heathen <S%H1471><s%> be judged <S%H8199><s%> in thy sight <S%H6440><s%>.
Put <S%H7896><s%> them in fear <S%H4172><s%> <S%H4172><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>: that the nations <S%H1471><s%> may know <S%H3045><s%> themselves to be but men <S%H582><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>.
